original: MASTER FRANCHISE AGREEMENT THE GRILLED CHEESE TRUCK, INC.
ollama_generated:
1. Limited Franchise Permission: Grantor permits Franchisee, under certain terms and conditions set forth herein and for valuable consideration acknowledged by both parties, to utilize the Grilled Cheese Truck trademarks and systems within [Specified Territory], limited to a single franchise operation. Franchisee shall have no claim or ownership of any other Grilled Cheese Trucks.

The original clause grants the Franchisee a right to operate one Grilled Cheese Truck franchise, which is non-exclusive, non-transferable, and revocable. The rewritten clause shifts the focus towards permission from the Grantor to utilize the trademarks and systems of the Grilled Cheese Truck within a specific territory for a single franchise operation, with no ownership or rights over any other Grilled Cheese Trucks. This change slightly weakens the Franchisee's position by emphasizing the limited nature of their agreement and shifting some control to the Grantor.

original: B. You desire us to grant you a license to use the methods, procedures and products developed by us and our parent (the “System”) to operate an independent business (the “Franchised Business”) that sells and services The Original Soupman franchises (“Unit Franchises”) to qualified individuals and business entities (“Unit Franchisees”) who will sell proprietary gourmet soups, chilis, stews, desserts, wraps and non- proprietary products like salads, sandwiches, specialty coffees, soft drinks and other beverages in the territory described in Section 1 of this Agreement, and you agree that your operation of the Franchised Business shall be governed by the terms, covenants and conditions contained in this Agreement. Our System includes a method of offering and selling Unit Franchises, management methods, marketing programs, financial reporting, Unit Franchisee performance reporting, and providing services to Unit Franchisees, all of which we may modify and/or update from time to time during the term of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
A. We grant you the privilege, at our sole discretion, to utilize the methods, procedures, and products (hereinafter referred to as "System") developed by us and our parent for the purpose of operating an independent venture (the "Franchise"), which will include the resale and servicing of The Original Soupman franchises ("Unit Franchises") to eligible individuals and entities ("Unit Franchisees"). You acknowledge that your management of the Franchise shall adhere to the provisions, commitments, and conditions outlined within this Agreement.

Please note that our System encompasses a system for offering and selling Unit Franchises, operational guidelines, marketing strategies, financial reporting, monitoring Unit Franchisee performance, and delivering services to Unit Franchisees. We retain the right to make any necessary modifications and updates to our System during the duration of this Agreement. However, your use of the System is subject to our approval, and we do not guarantee continuous access or adherence to the same terms throughout the term of this Agreement.

original: 1.3.1 To own, acquire, establish, and/or operate, and license others to establish and operate, other Franchised Businesses at any location outside of the Master Territory.
ollama_generated: 1.3.1 The Franchisee shall retain the exclusive right, without prior approval from the Company, to explore, acquire, or establish additional Franchised Businesses beyond the Master Territory, and may also grant licenses for such businesses to third parties.

original: 1.3.2 To own, acquire, establish and/or operate, and license others to establish and operate, businesses under other proprietary marks or other systems, whether such businesses are the same, similar, or different from the Franchised Business, at any location within or outside of the Master Territory.
ollama_generated: 1.3.2 The Franchisee shall retain the discretion and freedom to independently explore, establish, and operate, without prior approval from the Company, businesses under proprietary marks or systems that may resemble, bear some resemblance to, or differ entirely from the Franchised Business, at any location within or outside of the Master Territory. However, the Franchisee shall not use any trademarks identical or confusingly similar to the Company's registered marks in these new businesses. Furthermore, the Franchisee shall not grant licenses for such businesses to other parties within the Master Territory without the explicit written consent of the Company.

original: Source: SOUPMAN, INC., 8-K, 8/14/2015 2.3 Modifications to System and Manuals The System, our Operations Manual, and any other manuals loaned to you by us pursuant to this Agreement (collectively the “Manuals”), and the products and services offered by the Franchised Business may be modified by us at any time and from time to time, including, without limitation, by the addition, deletion and/or modification of operating procedures, products and services. You shall comply, at your expense, with all such additions, deletions and/or modifications, including, without limitation, all requirements to implement the addition, deletion and/or modification. You shall implement any System changes upon receipt of notice thereof from us and shall complete their implementation within such time as we may specify. You shall ensure that each Unit Franchisee in your Master Territory also complies with any System changes, as such changes may affect the Unit Franchisees.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: SOUPMAN, INC., 8-K, 8/14/2015 2.3 Amendments to System and Manuals The System, our Operations Manual, and any other manuals provided to you by us in accordance with this Agreement (collectively the “Manuals”), as well as the products and services offered by the Franchised Business, are subject to change at our discretion, including but not limited to modifications of operating procedures, products, and services. While we strongly recommend that you comply with any changes made, it is your choice whether or not to do so, unless explicitly required by law or contractual obligation. Any implementation of System changes will be your responsibility, both in terms of costs and timeline, and failure to comply may result in potential consequences as outlined in our agreement. It is suggested that each Unit Franchisee within your Master Territory also considers any applicable changes to the System.

original: 3.2.6 You shall execute a general release, in a form prescribed by us, of any and all claims which you may have or believe to have against us and/or our affiliates and our respective officers, directors, agents and employees, whether the claims are known or unknown, which are based on, arise from or relate to this Agreement or the Franchised Business, as well as claims, known or unknown, which are not based on, do not arise from or do not relate to this Agreement or the Franchised Business, but which relate to other franchise agreements, Franchised Businesses and other agreements between us or our affiliates and you which arose on or before the date of the general release, including, without limitation, all obligations, liabilities, demands, costs, expenses, damages, claims, actions and causes of action, of whatever nature, character or description, arising under federal, state and local laws, rules and ordinances (provided, however, that all rights enjoyed by you and any causes of action arising in your favor from the provisions of Article 33 of the New York General Business Law (“GBL”) and the regulations issued thereunder shall remain in force; it being the intent of this provision that the non-waiver provisions of GBL Sections 687.4 and 687.5 be satisfied).
ollama_generated:
3.2.6 We reserve the right to require you, at our discretion, to sign a general release, in a form provided by us, waiving any and all claims you may have or think you might have against us, our affiliates, and our respective officers, directors, agents, and employees. This release will cover known and unknown claims, arising from or related to this Agreement, the Franchised Business, or other franchise agreements, Franchised Businesses, and agreements between us and you that existed prior to the date of the general release.

However, your rights and any causes of action arising in your favor under Article 33 of the New York General Business Law (GBL) and its regulations shall remain unaffected by this provision, with the intention that the non-waiver provisions of GBL Sections 687.4 and 687.5 are satisfied. In essence, we aim to ensure that the non-waiver provisions of these sections are upheld in accordance with the law.

original: 4.2.2 You shall pay to us a franchise sales royalty fee (the “Franchise Sales Royalty Fee”) for each Unit Franchise you sell in the Master Territory as follows: twenty-five percent (25%) of the initial franchise fee collected from each Unit Franchisee upon execution of the Unit Franchisee’s Franchise Agreement (a “Unit Franchise Agreement”); provided, however, that if you elect to discount or reduce an initial franchise fee for any reason, the Franchise Sales Royalty Fee shall be payable to us as if the full initial franchise fee had been paid. The Franchise Sales Royalty Fee shall be paid by you to us at the same time and in the same manner as the Unit Franchise Performance Royalty Fee provided in Section 4.2.1 above. Any Royalty Fee you collect from the Franchisee shall be immediately paid to Us, but no later than the fifteen (15 th ) day of each calendar month. A Unit Franchise shall be deemed to be sold to a Unit Franchisee on the date that you and the Unit Franchisee execute the Unit Franchise Agreement, irrespective of when the Unit Franchise begins operation. Fees and Royalties cannot be increased or decreased without our prior written consent.
ollama_generated:
4.2.2 We retain the right to receive a franchise sales royalty fee (the "Franchise Sales Royalty Fee") from you for each Unit Franchise sold within the Master Territory, calculated as twenty-five percent (25%) of the initial franchise fee received by the Unit Franchisee upon execution of their Franchise Agreement. This obligation to pay the Franchise Sales Royalty Fee persists, even if you elect to offer a discount or reduction in the initial franchise fee for any reason; in such cases, the royalty payment will be based on the full undiscounted amount.

The Franchise Sales Royalty Fee should be remitted to us at the same time and in the same manner as the Unit Franchise Performance Royalty Fee, as specified in Section 4.2.1 above. Any royalty fees collected from the Franchisee must be forwarded to us without delay, but no later than the fifteenth (15th) day of each calendar month. For the purposes of this agreement, a Unit Franchise is considered sold on the date when both you and the Unit Franchisee have signed the Unit Franchise Agreement, regardless of the commencement date of the franchise's operations.

Any adjustments to the Franchise Sales Royalty Fee or other fees and royalties require our prior written consent.

original: Source: SOUPMAN, INC., 8-K, 8/14/2015 4.2.3 In addition to the Unit Franchise Performance Royalty Fee and Franchise Sales Royalty Fee described above, you shall collect from each Unit Franchisee in your Master Territory a “National Advertising Fund Contribution” to be contributed to our “National Advertising Fund” pursuant to the terms of the individual Unit Franchise Agreements. For each Unit Franchise you own and operate, you shall pay the National Advertising Fund Contribution on the same basis as Unit Franchisees. The National Advertising Fund Contribution shall be collected by you from each Unit Franchisee and spent by you in accordance with the agreement on behalf of the franchisor and Franchisees.
modified:
Clause:
Revised: SUPERFOODS, LLC, 12-K, 9/30/2021 (4.2.3) In lieu of the Unit Franchise Performance Royalty Fee and Franchise Sales Royalty Fee outlined previously, each Master Franchisee within your designated territory is expected to contribute a "National Marketing Contribution" to our "Centralized Marketing Fund," as stipulated in individual Unit Franchise Agreements. For any Unit Franchises owned and managed by you, the Centralized Marketing Contribution will be equivalent. This contribution shall not be remitted by you but retained by each Unit Franchisee within your Master Territory, with the understanding that they are responsible for its disbursement in accordance with the agreement, acting autonomously on behalf of the franchisor and fellow Franchisees. The Centralized Marketing Fund will be utilized as per the established guidelines, without any direct involvement from you.

original: Source: SOUPMAN, INC., 8-K, 8/14/2015 4.8 Reimbursement of Monies You shall pay to us, within fifteen (15) days of any written request by us accompanied by reasonable substantiating material, any monies which we have paid, or have become obligated to pay, on your behalf by consent or otherwise under this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: SOUPMAN, INC., 8-K, 8/14/2015 4.8 Reimbursement of Monies
We reserve the right to request, within a fifteen (15) day period following any written inquiry from us, supported by reasonable substantiating material, repayment from you of any monies that we may have expended or become obligated to pay on your behalf, either by agreement or otherwise, under this Agreement. Such reimbursement shall be made promptly upon our request to ensure a timely resolution.

original: (d) In order to keep your exclusivity, you agree to purchase a minimum of the following:
ollama_generated: (d) To maintain your exclusive status, we request that you consider making regular purchases with a recommended minimum quantity, but it is not binding and discretion in your spending decisions remains yours.

original: Source: SOUPMAN, INC., 8-K, 8/14/2015 (f) We shall be permitted to sell branded products to national accounts without any money due to you or your parent company. Once you have units open and operating in the trade area where a National Account is located, we will remit to you 25% of the profits derived from the sales in that specific trade area.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: SOUPMAN, INC., 8-K, 8/14/2015 (f) We reserve the right to sell branded products to national accounts without any obligation to pay you or your parent company until such time as you have units operational in the trade area associated with that National Account. Upon the operation of your units within the specified trade area, we will remit 25% of the profits derived from sales in that area to you. This payment will be made retroactive to the date of our initial sale to the relevant national account.

original: (g) We will continue to collect the royalties from franchisees and service existing franchisee in the Master Territory.
ollama_generated: (g) Franchisees within the Master Territory shall remain responsible for remitting their royalties directly to us, while we assume the obligation to manage and provide ongoing services to these existing franchisees.

original: 5.1.1 In addition to The Original Soupman business you must own and continuously operate, you must sell and have open the minimum number of The Original Soupman businesses as set forth on Attachment E hereto (the “Minimum Development Quota”) by the dates set forth on such Attachment. We will not grant other franchises nor establish our own Unit Franchises within the Master Territory during the term of this Agreement unless you do not meet the Minimum Development Quota. If you do not meet the Minimum Development Quota, we may cancel your exclusive right to market and sell Unit Franchises in your Master Territory and may sell additional Master Franchises within your Master Territory, or we may begin operations of our own in your Master Territory, or we may terminate this Agreement.

5.1.3 You must charge your Unit Franchisees the initial franchise fee, royalty fee, National Advertising Fund Contribution and any other continuing fees that we designate or require, within the limits established by all regulatory agencies which now or hereafter may have jurisdiction over the sale of franchises and the requirements imposed by this Agreement. Any deviations from these amounts must be pre- approved by us.
ollama_generated: 5.1.3 It is at your discretion to determine the amount charged for initial franchise fees, royalty fees, National Advertising Fund Contributions, and any other ongoing fees, as specified or requested by us, subject to the minimums and maximums established by all regulatory agencies with jurisdiction over franchise sales and the terms of this Agreement. Any deviations from these minimum amounts require our prior written approval.

original: 5.2.3 You will further support and assist each Unit Franchisee by:
ollama_generated: 5.2.3 It is not mandatory for you to provide extensive support to each Unit Franchisee, but rather, your role may include offering reasonable assistance when feasible and convenient for you. However, we encourage a cooperative spirit in fostering the success of our franchisees.

original: (a) Making available to each Unit Franchisee in the Master Territory all applicable Manuals, training aids and any pertinent information concerning the System.
ollama_generated: (a) Providing access to each Unit Franchisee within the Master Territory with essential Manuals, training materials, and any relevant knowledge regarding the System; however, the Franchisee is responsible for seeking out and utilizing this information independently, without guarantee of ongoing support or updates.

original: 5.5 Insurance During the term of this Agreement, you shall maintain in force under policies of insurance issued by licensed insurers approved by us insurance coverage as we from time to time require. You must maintain insurance related to your operation of the Franchised Business. Such insurance coverage will include:
ollama_generated:
5.5 Insurance Throughout the duration of this Agreement, it is recommended (not mandatory) that you keep in effect appropriate insurance policies, issued by approved insurers, as we may deem necessary from time to time. While maintaining such insurance coverage for your operation of the Franchised Business is strongly advised, the responsibility for securing these insurance policies lies primarily with you. The scope of the required insurance coverage shall encompass:

This revised clause weakens the obligation of the party, by making the maintenance of insurance a recommendation instead of a requirement, and shifts the responsibility for procuring the insurance to the party. It also clarifies that the scope of the required insurance coverage includes the operation of the Franchised Business.

original: 5.5.1 As it relates to the operation of your Franchised Business: broad form comprehensive general liability coverage against claims for employment practices coverage, bodily and personal injury, death and property damage caused by or occurring in conjunction with the conduct of business by you pursuant to this Agreement and broad form contractual liability coverage, including errors and omissions coverage, under one or more policies of insurance containing minimum liability coverage prescribed by us from time to time, but in no event in an amount less than Two Million Dollars ($2,000,000) aggregate. Such insurance shall not have a deductible or self-insured retention in excess of Five Thousand Dollars ($5,000); 5.5.2 As it relates to the operation of your Franchised Business: automobile liability insurance coverage, including owned and non-owned vehicles, with limits of not less than One Million Dollars ($1,000,000) per occurrence; Source: SOUPMAN, INC., 8-K, 8/14/2015 5.5.3 As it relates to the operation of your Franchised Business: worker’s compensation and employer’s liability insurance in statutory amounts, unemployment insurance and state disability insurance as required by governing law for your employees; 5.5.4 As it relates to the Unit Franchisees’ operation in the Master Territory, and if you elect to obtain such coverage: general liability insurance, which insurance is in addition to any general liability insurance the Unit Franchisees are required to maintain under their Unit Franchise Agreements.
ollama_generated:
5.5.1 In terms of your operation of the Franchised Business, you shall maintain broad form comprehensive general liability coverage against claims for employment practices, bodily and personal injury, death, and property damage resulting from business activities under this Agreement. This coverage should include contractual liability, errors and omissions coverage, and be under one or more policies of insurance, with minimum prescribed liability coverage by us, but not less than Two Million Dollars ($2,000,000) in total. The policy shall have a deductible or self-insured retention of no more than Five Thousand Dollars ($5,000).

  5.5.2 Concerning your Franchised Business operation, you are responsible for obtaining automobile liability insurance coverage, encompassing owned and non-owned vehicles, with a per occurrence limit not less than One Million Dollars ($1,000,000).

  5.5.3 For the operation of your Franchised Business, you shall provide worker’s compensation and employer’s liability insurance, unemployment insurance, and state disability insurance as required by applicable law for your employees.

  5.5.4 In case you choose to secure additional coverage, Unit Franchisees operating within the Master Territory will be responsible for maintaining general liability insurance, which is over and above any general liability insurance they are obligated to have under their Unit Franchise Agreements.

original: 5.7 Payment of Taxes You shall pay all personal property, sales, excise, use, and other taxes, regardless of type or nature, which may be imposed, levied, assessed or charged, on, against, or in connection with the Franchised Business and any products, services or equipment sold or furnished hereunder, whether those taxes are imposed by any federal, state, municipality, county or parish, or other governmental unity or agency, which may have jurisdiction over such products, services and equipment. It shall be your sole responsibility to insure that any Unit Franchisee operating in the Master Territory shall also comply with this Section 5.7 as it may apply to the operation of the Unit Franchisee’s business.
ollama_generated: 5.7 Tax Liability Shifted: The Corporation assumes primary responsibility for the payment of all personal property, sales, excise, use, and other taxes imposed, levied, assessed or charged on, against, or in connection with the Franchised Business and any products, services, or equipment sold or furnished hereunder. This includes taxes at any level, by any governmental entity or agency with jurisdiction over such products, services, and equipment. However, it is incumbent upon each Unit Franchisee operating within the Master Territory to ensure their compliance with this Section 5.7, as it may apply specifically to their business operations.

original: 5.10.2 If you request that we provide additional training or assistance on-site at your Franchised Business, you must pay our then-current per diem fee for each representative we send to you to provide training or assistance, and you must reimburse each representative’s travel, lodging and meals expenses while providing the additional on-site training or assistance.
ollama_generated: 5.10.2 Upon your request for on-site training or assistance at your Franchised Business, we reserve the right to charge a per diem fee for each of our representatives dispatched, and we may seek reimbursement for their travel, lodging, and meal expenses during this period. However, it is important to note that these fees are intended to cover our operational costs and should not be construed as compensation or remuneration for the time and expertise our representatives bring to your Franchised Business.

original: 5.13 Office Location You shall be solely responsible for any leases of real or personal property in connection with the operation of your Franchised Business. We reserve the right, but are not required to, approve your office location and any leasehold improvements to such location to protect our image, reputation and goodwill. You may elect to operate the Franchised Business from The Original Soupman business you must own and operate, once such business is open and operating.
ollama_generated: 5.13 Office Location: We shall have the option, but not the obligation, to approve your chosen location for the operation of your Franchised Business, including any lease agreements for real or personal property. You will be responsible for securing our approval prior to signing any such leases. Any leasehold improvements made to the approved location should align with preserving and enhancing our image, reputation, and goodwill. It is at your discretion to operate the Franchised Business from an existing The Original Soupman business, provided it is duly established and operational before the commencement of your Franchised Business.

original: 5.19 Our Website We or one or more of our designees may establish a website or series of websites for the System to advertise, market and promote The Original Soupman businesses and the products and services they offer, the Unit Franchise and/or master franchise opportunity, and/or for any other purposes that we determine are appropriate for The Original Soupman businesses (collectively, the “System Website”). If we include information about your Franchised Business on the System Website, you agree to give us the information and materials that we periodically request concerning the Franchised Business and otherwise participate in the System Website in the manner that we periodically specify. By posting or submitting to us information or materials for the System Website, you are representing to us that the information and materials are accurate and not misleading and do not infringe upon any third party’s rights.
ollama_generated:
5.19 As a Franchisee, you acknowledge and consent to our right, or that of our designated representatives, to create and maintain one or more websites (collectively referred to as the "System Website") for promoting The Original Soupman businesses, their products, services, and franchising opportunities. It is expected that we may share information about your Franchised Business on these websites. To facilitate this, you agree to promptly provide us with the information and materials we periodically request concerning your Franchise Business. Furthermore, you understand that your participation in the System Website will be guided by our periodic specifications.

By submitting information or materials for inclusion on the System Website, you warrant their accuracy, honesty, and compliance with all relevant third-party rights. You acknowledge full responsibility for any potential infringements arising from the submitted content.

original: We shall own all intellectual property and other rights in the System Website and all information it contains, including the domain name or uniform resource locator (“URL”) for the System Website, the log of “hits” by visitors, and any personal or business data that visitors (including you and your personnel) supply. We may implement and periodically modify System standards relating to the System Website and, at our option, may discontinue the System Website, or any services offered through the System Website, at any time.
ollama_generated: The ownership of all intellectual property rights, including but not limited to the System Website, its content, domain name or URL, visitor logs, and any data provided by visitors (including yourself and your associates), shall reside with you. However, we reserve the right to establish and periodically adjust standards regarding the System Website, and at our discretion, modify or discontinue the System Website, or any services associated with it, at any given time. This modification shifts the ownership rights while maintaining a professional and realistic tone.

original: Source: SOUPMAN, INC., 8-K, 8/14/2015 5.20.3 Upon receipt of notice from us that we have established the Intranet, you shall establish and continually maintain (during all times that the Intranet shall be established and until the termination of this Agreement) an electronic connection (the specifications of which shall be specified in the Manuals) with the Intranet that allows us to send messages to and receive messages from you, subject to our standards and specifications.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: SOUPMAN, INC., 8-K, 8/14/2015 5.20.3 Commencing from the notification of our establishment of the Intranet, you have the discretion to establish and maintain (though not required if the Intranet is not operational) an electronic connection (with specifications provided in the Manuals) with the Intranet. This connection should enable us to send messages to and receive messages from you, under our mutual understanding of standards and specifications, though any deviation from these shall be at your sole discretion. The obligation will cease upon termination of this Agreement or when the Intranet is no longer operational.

original: 5.20.5 You shall, at our option and request, and without any additional consideration, assign to us all rights to all e-mail addresses, URLs, domain names, Internet listings, and Internet accounts related to the Franchised Business following demand by us upon your misuse of the same and/or the termination or expiration of this Agreement. Furthermore, you hereby appoint us as your attorney-in-fact with full power and authority for the sole purpose of assigning these rights to us. This appointment shall be deemed to be coupled with an interest and shall continue in full force and effect until and following the termination or expiration of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
5.20.5 Upon our request, either during the agreement's term or upon its termination or expiry, prompted by your misuse of e-mail addresses, URLs, domain names, Internet listings, and Internet accounts associated with the Franchised Business, you shall assign all rights to these assets to us without any further compensation. This assignment grants us the power of attorney, solely for this purpose, effective immediately and persisting until the agreement's conclusion.

In essence, by this clause, you grant us a perpetual right of survivorship over these digital assets during the term of this Agreement, which will automatically transfer to us upon its termination or expiration if misuse occurs.

original: 6.2.5 You shall not use the Proprietary Marks to incur any obligation or indebtedness on our behalf.

original: 6.2.8 You shall promptly notify us of any suspected unauthorized use of or any challenge to the validity of the Proprietary Marks, or any challenge to our or our affiliate’s ownership of, our license to use and to license others to use, or your right to use, the Proprietary Marks licensed under this Agreement. You acknowledge that we or our affiliate have the right to direct and control any administrative proceeding or litigation, or other adjudicative proceeding involving the Proprietary Marks, including any settlement thereof. We or our affiliate have the right, but not the obligation, to take action against uses by others that may constitute infringement of the Proprietary Marks. We shall defend you against any third-party claim, suit, or demand arising out of your use of the Proprietary Marks; provided, however, that your use of the Proprietary Marks is in compliance with this Agreement. If we, in our sole discretion, determine that you have used the Proprietary Marks in accordance with this Agreement, the cost of such defense, including the cost of any judgment or settlement, shall be borne by us. If we, in our sole discretion, determine that you have not used the Proprietary Marks in accordance with this Agreement, the cost of such defense, including the cost of any judgment or settlement, shall be borne by you. In the event of any litigation relating to your use of the Proprietary Marks, you shall execute any and all documents and do such acts as may, in our opinion, be necessary to carry out such defense or prosecution, including, but not limited to, becoming a nominal party to any legal action. Except to the extent that such litigation is the result of your use of the Proprietary Marks in a manner inconsistent with the terms of this Agreement, we agree to reimburse you for your out-of-pocket litigation costs in doing such acts.
ollama_generated: 6.2.8 While not mandatory, it is strongly recommended that you inform us, at your convenience, of any perceived misuse of or contestation towards the validity of the Proprietary Marks, or any disputes regarding our or our affiliate's right to use and license others to use, as well as your right to utilize the Proprietary Marks under this Agreement. It is understood that we or our affiliate hold the prerogative to manage and control any administrative proceedings, litigation, or other adjudicative processes concerning the Proprietary Marks, including any settlement arrangements. We retain the option, but not the obligation, to act against instances of potential infringement on the Proprietary Marks. In situations where we deem your use of the Proprietary Marks compliant with this Agreement, we will assume responsibility for the expenses associated with defending such use, including any judgments or settlements. However, should we determine that your utilization of the Proprietary Marks contravenes the terms of this Agreement, you shall bear the costs of defense, as well as any resulting judgments or settlements. In the event of litigation related to your employment of the Proprietary Marks, you will be expected to sign any necessary documents and perform required actions, as deemed essential by us, to facilitate such defense or prosecution, including, but not limited to, serving as a nominal party in legal proceedings. Except when such litigation arises from your use of the Proprietary Marks contrary to this Agreement's terms, we will reimburse you for any out-of-pocket expenses incurred during these actions.

original: 6.3.1 As between you and us, we are the owner of all right, title, and interest in and to the Proprietary Marks and the goodwill associated with and symbolized by them and we have the right to use, and license others to use, the Proprietary Marks.
modified: 6.3.1 It is acknowledged and agreed that the ownership of all rights, titles, and interests in and to the Proprietary Marks, as well as the goodwill associated with them, resides solely with you. However, you grant us a non-exclusive license to use the Proprietary Marks on our behalf and extend this right to other parties at our discretion.

original: 6.3.5 Any and all goodwill arising from your use of the Proprietary Marks shall inure solely and exclusively to the benefit of us or our affiliate, and upon expiration or termination of this Agreement and the license herein granted no monetary amount shall be assigned as attributable to any goodwill associated with your use.
ollama_generated: 6.3.5 The beneficial interest from any goodwill generated during your usage of the Proprietary Marks belongs solely and exclusively to us or our affiliate, and upon the termination or expiration of this Agreement, no monetary compensation will be paid for any goodwill value tied to your usage. Instead, all rights to the goodwill will revert back to us.

original: 6.3.8 We shall have the right, at all reasonable times, to inspect the products and services on which the Proprietary Marks shall be used as we consider necessary to carry out the purposes of inspection as part of appropriate quality control. Upon request, you shall submit to us all packages, labels, advertising, advertising brochures and other materials bearing the Proprietary Marks and you specifically undertake to amend to our satisfaction any such packages, labels, advertising, advertising brochures and other materials which are not approved by us.
ollama_generated: 6.3.8 The obligation to allow inspections for quality control purposes pertaining to the use of Proprietary Marks on products and services rests solely with you. You shall make these items available for our inspection at your own discretion, but we reserve the right to request access when deemed necessary by us. Upon our request, you shall provide us with all packages, labels, advertising materials, brochures, and other items bearing the Proprietary Marks. Additionally, it is understood that we may require modifications to any unapproved materials, but the responsibility for these changes lies with you.

original: 7.1.3 Own, maintain, operate, engage in, or have any interest in any business which is the same as or similar to the Franchised Business, or any other business which performs any type of child tutoring services, anywhere.
modified: 7.1.3 Abstain from personally owning, maintaining, operating, engaging in, or holding any significant stake in any business that offers identical or substantially similar child tutoring services, or any enterprise performing such services, globally; provided, however, that this restriction shall not apply to passively held investments where the Franchisee does not exercise control over the management of the investment.

original: 7.2 Independent Covenants Each of the foregoing covenants shall be construed as independent of any other covenant or provision of this Agreement. If all or any portion of any covenant in this Section 7 is held unreasonable or unenforceable by a court having valid jurisdiction in any unappealed final decision to which we are a party, you and your principals shall be bound by any lesser covenant subsumed within the terms of such covenant that imposes the maximum duty permitted by law, as if the resulting covenant were separately stated in and made a part of this Section 7.
modified: 7.2 Interdependent Obligations Each obligation in this Section 7 is interconnected yet distinct from any other provision within this Agreement. In the event that any obligation in Section 7 is deemed unreasonable or unenforceable by a court with proper jurisdiction and an uncontested final ruling, the remaining obligations shall be proportionally adjusted to constitute the minimum permissible duties, as if they were separately outlined and incorporated within this Agreement for the purpose of ensuring compliance with the law. In such a case, you and your associated parties will remain bound by these revised obligations.

original: 7.5 Irreparable Injury You acknowledge and agree that any violation of the terms of this Section 7 would result in irreparable injury to us, for which no adequate remedy at law may be available, and you consent that we may apply for the issuance of an injunction prohibiting any conduct by you in violation of this Section 7, without the posting of any bond.
ollama_generated: 7.5 Potential Harm: You acknowledge and accept that engaging in actions contrary to the provisions outlined in this Section 7 could potentially cause harm to us, for which legal remedies alone may not suffice entirely. In such circumstances, you grant us permission to seek a court order prohibiting your actions in violation of this Section 7, without requiring the posting of a bond on our part.

original: 9.4 Proprietary Marks We will allow you to use the Proprietary Marks in the Master Territory, subject to the limitations and restrictions set forth in this Agreement, and to use the processes, methods, materials, equipment and promotional plans developed by us.
ollama_generated:
9.4 Permitted Usage: The rights granted to you for utilizing our Proprietary Marks within the Master Territory are contingent upon adherence to all terms and conditions outlined in this Agreement. Additionally, your authorization extends only to employing the processes, methods, materials, equipment, and promotional strategies that we have specifically provided or approved by us.

In this revised clause, the original obligation for the user to use the processes, methods, materials, equipment, and promotional plans developed by the other party has been shifted, requiring that the user only utilize the ones that have been specifically provided or approved by the other party.

original: 10.2.1 If you at any time cease to operate or otherwise abandon the Franchised Business without our consent, or otherwise forfeit the right to do or transact business in the Master Territory.
ollama_generated: 10.2.1 In the event that we decide to terminate your operation of the Franchised Business, or if we deem it necessary for any reason to restrict your ability to conduct business within the Master Territory, you shall comply without delay and relinquish all rights associated with such activities.

original: 10.2.8 If you, after curing a default pursuant to Section 10.3 of this Agreement, commit the same, similar, or different default again, whether or not cured after notice, or if you incur three (3) late fees or insufficient funds fees in any twelve (12) month period.
ollama_generated: 10.2.8 If, following a remedy of a breach under Section 10.3 of this Agreement, a subsequent identical, similar, or distinct breach occurs on your part, without requiring prior notice for it to be deemed as such, or if you incur more than three (3) late fees or insufficient funds fees within any consecutive twelve (12) month period, the responsibility for addressing these repeated actions shall primarily rest with you.

original: 10.2.14 If, within ten (10) days after receipt of written notice from us that any required payment is overdue, you do not make such payment to us, our affiliates, or to your suppliers or creditors unless, with respect to your suppliers or creditors, you notify us of the existence on a bona fide dispute and takes immediate action to resolve it.
modified: 10.2.14 In case a payment due to us or our affiliates becomes overdue following receipt of a written notice from us within ten (10) days, your obligation to settle the debt is extended to twenty (20) days, provided that during this period, you have notified us about a bona fide dispute with your suppliers or creditors. In such cases, you are only required to make the payment to them if you promptly inform us of the dispute and actively endeavor to resolve it in good faith.

original: 10.2.19 If you fail to register the Unit Franchise Disclosure Document with any registration state applicable to the Master Territory or if you violate any requirements of applicable federal or state law related to the disclosure and sale of franchises.
ollama_generated: 10.2.19 In the event that we, at our discretion, choose not to register the Unit Franchise Disclosure Document with any registration state applicable to the Master Territory, or if we elect not to comply with any requirements of applicable federal or state law regarding the disclosure and sale of franchises, you shall bear the sole responsibility for any resulting liabilities or penalties.

original: 10.2.20 If you fail to comply with the Minimum Development Quota.
ollama_generated:
10.2.20 In the event that the Minimum Development Quota is not met by you.

This rewording keeps the original meaning (triggering the clause when the Minimum Development Quota is not complied with) but shifts the responsibility to "you" and inverts the condition by stating the situation in the negative, which could potentially be perceived as less demanding or more lenient. However, it's important to note that the interpretation of contracts lies within the domain of law and legal professionals, so this rewording should be reviewed by a legal expert for accuracy and appropriateness in a specific context.

original: 10.3 Termination with Notice and Opportunity to Cure Except as otherwise provided in Sections 10.1 and 10.2 of this Agreement, you shall have thirty (30) days after your receipt from us of a written notice of default within which to remedy any default under this Agreement and to provide evidence thereof to us. If any such default is not cured within the specified time, or such longer period as applicable law may require, we shall have the right to terminate this Agreement by providing written notice of termination to you. You shall be in default pursuant to this Section 10.3 for failure to substantially comply with any of the requirements imposed by this Agreement, as it may from time to time reasonably be modified or supplemented by the Manuals, or your failure to carry out the terms of this Agreement in good faith.
modified:
10.3 Notice and Opportunity for Correction, with Immediate Termination Rights
Except as stipulated in Sections 10.1 and 10.2 of this Agreement, we reserve the right to terminate this Agreement immediately upon providing you written notice of any perceived default under this Agreement, without granting a remediation period or allowing evidence of correction. However, if we elect not to exercise our immediate termination rights, you will be granted a grace period of thirty (30) days to rectify the default, as per applicable law's requirements for reasonable notice. Should any default persist after this period, or should the default recur following rectification, we retain the right to terminate this Agreement without further notice. Any breach of the agreement's terms, including but not limited to substantial non-compliance with requirements, as may be reasonably amended or supplemented by the Manuals, or lack of good faith execution of this Agreement, will be deemed a default under this Section 10.3.

original: Source: SOUPMAN, INC., 8-K, 8/14/2015 In each of the foregoing cases, we (and any of our affiliates) will have all remedies allowed at law, including termination of your rights (and/or those of any person/company affiliated with you) and our (and/or our affiliates’) obligations. No right or remedy which we may have (including termination) is exclusive of any other right or remedy provided under law or equity and we may pursue any rights and/or remedies available.
ollama_generated: Source: SOUPMAN, INC., 8-K, 8/14/2015 In all the aforementioned situations, we (and any of our affiliates) reserve the right to exercise all legal remedies, including, but not limited to, the modification or suspension of your rights (and/or those of any party associated with you), as well as our (and/or our affiliates’) continued performance of obligations. The pursuit of any right or remedy by us (including modification or suspension) does not exclude other rights and remedies available under law or equity, and we maintain the flexibility to utilize any additional legal avenues at our disposal.

original: 12.3.3 In the event of any such default, and if we choose to be substituted as obligor, we shall be so substituted in all respects on the same terms and conditions to which you were subject, except that any acceleration of the obligations secured, due to your default, shall be void upon cure by us.
ollama_generated:
12.3.3 In case of any such default on your part, you hereby grant us the option, but not the obligation, to assume the role of obligor. If we elect to do so, we will fulfill our obligations under the same terms and conditions that applied to you, except that should any acceleration of the secured obligations result from your default, it shall only remain in effect if such acceleration persists following our remedy of the default.

The difference lies in the shifted responsibility: instead of us having the obligation to assume the role of obligor, we are now given an option (but not an obligation). Additionally, the acceleration of obligations due to default can only remain effective after our remedy of the default, whereas the original clause stated it would become void upon our cure.

original: 16.6.3 If Master Franchisee is a trust, each trustee, trustor and beneficiary signing this Agreement shall be liable for all of the obligations and duties of Master Franchisee under this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 16.6.3 In the event that Master Franchisee is a trust, solely the Trustee(s) shall bear responsibility for fulfilling all obligations and duties incumbent upon Master Franchisee as outlined in this Agreement. It is understood, however, that each Trustor and Beneficiary associated with the trust may be called upon to provide support or assistance in the event of a breach or default by the Trustee.

original: 16.7.3 If you are a limited liability company, you shall: (a) furnish us with a copy of your articles of organization and operating agreement, as well as such other documents as we may reasonably request, and any amendments thereto; (b) prepare and furnish to us a Schedule of Principals with a current list of all members and managers in you; and (c) maintain stop transfer instructions on your records against the transfer of equity securities and shall only issue securities upon the face of which bear a legend, in a form satisfactory to us. In addition, each present and future member of yours shall jointly and severally guarantee your performance of each and every provision of this Agreement by executing a Guarantee in the form attached to this Agreement as Attachment B.
ollama_generated: 16.7.3 Should you operate as a limited liability company, we reserve the right to request, at our discretion, copies of your articles of organization and operating agreement, along with any subsequent amendments, and other pertinent documents. Furthermore, you are expected to prepare and provide us with an updated Schedule of Principals, including all current members and managers. Regarding the transfer of equity securities, we expect you to maintain stop transfer instructions on your records and issue securities bearing a legend acceptable to us, without prior instruction from us. In this agreement's performance, each present and future member is not required but has the option to jointly and severally indemnify our interests by executing a Guarantee in the form provided as Attachment B.

ollama_generated:

This revision weakens the obligation slightly, making it sound like the security interest is used to guarantee repayment not just of debts, but also of any other specified amount. This could potentially open up a wider range of applications or interpretations.

original: Source: SOUPMAN, INC., 8-K, 8/14/2015 18.6 Special Filing as Financing Statement This Agreement shall be deemed a Security Agreement and a Financing Statement. This Agreement may be filed for record in the real estate records of each county in which the Collateral, or any part thereof, is situated and may also be filed as a Financing Statement in the counties or in the office of the Secretary of State, as appropriate, in respect of those items of Collateral of a kind or character defined in or subject to the applicable provisions of the Uniform Commercial Code as in effect in the appropriate jurisdiction.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Alteration: Strengthen an obligation and invert a condition

This Agreement shall function as both a Security Agreement and a Financing Statement, subject to the discretion of SOUPMAN, INC. The terms of this Agreement may be proactively filed in the real estate records of each county where the Collateral resides, or any part thereof, or in relevant counties, or the office of the Secretary of State, whichever is deemed appropriate by us, as necessary for protecting our interests concerning those items of Collateral that fall under the purview of the Uniform Commercial Code applicable jurisdiction. We reserve the right to file this Agreement as a Financing Statement prioritizing our interests over any other potential claimants.

original: 19. ACKNOWLEDGMENTS 19.1 Recognition of Business Risks You acknowledge that you have conducted an independent investigation of the proposed franchise, and recognize that the business venture contemplated by this Agreement involves business risks and that your success will be largely dependent upon your ability as an independent business person. We expressly disclaim the making of, and you acknowledge that you have not received, any warranty or guarantee, express or implied, as to the potential sales, income, profits, or success of the business venture contemplated by this Agreement, or of other Franchised Businesses.
ollama_generated:
19. UNDERSTANDING OF BUSINESS RISKS

19.1 Awareness of Potential Challenges
You are aware that you have carried out an independent examination of the proposed franchise, and acknowledge that the business endeavor outlined in this Agreement entails potential risks inherent to any business venture. We make no representations or warranties, either expressed or implied, concerning the possible sales, income, profits, or success of the business venture envisioned by this Agreement, or of any other Franchised Businesses. It is you who shall bear the responsibility for your own business performance, understanding that success will largely depend on your skills and adaptability as an entrepreneur within this system.

original: 19.9 Additional Documents Each of the parties agrees to execute, acknowledge and deliver to the other party and to procure the execution, acknowledgment and delivery to the other party of any additional documents or instruments which either party may reasonably require to fully effectuate and carry out the provisions of this Agreement.
modified: 19.9 Supplementary Documents At the discretion of any Party, there is no obligation for any Party to execute, acknowledge, or deliver additional documents or instruments requested by another Party. However, each Party shall make reasonable efforts to facilitate the procurement of such supplementary documents or instruments if they are deemed necessary by the requesting Party, but neither party will be held responsible for the failure of the other Party to provide them.

original: 19.10 Counterparts This Agreement may be executed by the parties in one or more counterparts, each of which shall be deemed to be an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument.
ollama_generated: 19.10 Multiple Executions: It is permissible for this Agreement to be signed by the parties individually on separate documents, with each such document being considered an authentic original. Notwithstanding, all these individual executions shall collectively represent a single unified instrument, binding under the terms herein.

original: THE GRILLED CHEESE TRUCK, INC.
modified:
THE INCEPTIVE GRILLED CHEESE ENTITY (hereinafter "Entity"),

In the event of any dispute or claim arising out of or in connection with this agreement, it shall be the exclusive responsibility of the counterparty to initiate resolution proceedings within a period of thirty (30) days following the occurrence of the event. If no resolution is sought within such timeframe, the Entity shall retain the right to proceed without further obligation or liability to the counterparty regarding the matter at hand.

Moreover, in the event that the counterparty initiates proceedings, the Entity reserves the right to recover all reasonable costs and expenses associated with the dispute resolution process, including but not limited to legal fees, expert witness fees, and administrative costs. The counterparty acknowledges and agrees to this provision as a part of the agreement.

In essence, the counterparty hereby assumes the risk of any potential disputes or claims and waives its right to recover costs and expenses associated with such matters, unless otherwise explicitly provided for in this agreement.

original: Address:

Address Requirements:

In this agreement, the parties shall maintain a valid and up-to-date address for service of legal notices, communications, or other official correspondence at all times during the term of this contract. Failure to provide a current address or notify the other party of any change in address within five (5) business days shall not relieve either party from their obligations under this agreement, but may result in delays or difficulties in serving legal notices or communicating effectively. The parties acknowledge that it is their responsibility to ensure proper service of legal notices and other official correspondence by keeping the other party informed of any changes in their contact information.

Relationship: Mutual Agreement for Connection:

The original clause requires one party to maintain the telephone relationship, implying an obligation on their part. In the rewritten version, I've shifted the focus to a mutual agreement for communication, which implies that both parties have an equal responsibility to maintain the connection. This change subtly weakens the initial obligation and makes the language more symmetrical.
